text: It is appalling that Cornell University appears ready to deport an international student without regard for due process, simply because of their presence at a protest. It is wrong, and I urge the university to reverse course immediately. https://t.co/JSrxOzVxKl

Why do working class people live shorter lives than the very wealthy?

Stress.

When you're worried about your landlord raising the rent ... when your medical debt is driving you toward bankruptcy ... when you're working two or three jobs ...

It takes a toll on your health. https://t.co/LJzwOl51kM

It's going to be a good week.

I hope you can join me, @GregCasar, and @AOC in Texas, and help us show the strength of the progressive movement across this country. https://t.co/nnpCqsBAkg

Since 2018, Novo Nordisk has made nearly $50 billion in sales off of Ozempic and Wegovy. 

72% of that revenue coming from sales in the U.S.
 
In other words, the United States is Novo Nordisk’s cash cow.

Our ask is simple: Stop exploiting American patients. https://t.co/GJZ6yY0jpr
Cancel student debt. All of it. https://t.co/jL9305YObd

Here's a big secret:

Progressive economic policies are ENORMOUSLY popular among the American people.

84% want to expand Medicare to cover dental, vision, and hearing.

84% want to cut prescription drug costs in half.

82% want the wealthy to pay their fair share in taxes. https://t.co/dpI5Y4oSkH

Americans funded the development of all 10 drugs up for price negotiations under Medicare, shelling out a total of $11.7 billion on their research.

In 2022 alone, Big Pharma made $70 billion selling those same drugs.

Does that make sense to you? https://t.co/ArkJig5DJw

Federal spending on weight loss drugs hit $7.9 billion last year.

Unless Novo Nordisk substantially lowers the cost of Ozempic and Wegovy, the company threatens to bankrupt Medicare. https://t.co/unS9XuQe4O
Yes, the pharmaceutical industry can afford to substantially lower the price of prescription drugs in this country. https://t.co/3y07ATNFyN

Congratulations to the Teamster locals across the country — from Michigan to Nevada — for endorsing the Harris/Walz ticket.

Union workers know that the choice is clear:

Donald Trump betrayed workers.

Biden/Harris fought for workers.

https://t.co/hvoDT6rdDO

According to a CBS poll, 61% of Americans oppose sending weapons and supplies to Israel.

The American people understand that it is wrong to give money to a right wing, extremist government that is creating one of the worst humanitarian disasters in modern history. https://t.co/8C1KwTK5kz

This report should come as no surprise: we have one of the worst health care systems in the world. 

A rational health care system should be providing universal, quality, cost-effective care. 

Not maximizing the profits of insurance & drug companies.  

https://t.co/h1gpZZKgqv

.@realDonaldTrump has been in three political campaigns.

He was president for four years.

We are in the midst of a serious health care crisis — 85 million Americans are uninsured or underinsured.

Now he's working on "a concept of a plan" ??

That's not going to cut it. https://t.co/2aK8C9NSS7
https://t.co/gEcwASAGwW

Much of the carnage in Gaza has been carried out with U.S.-provided military equipment.

Why on earth would the U.S. approve another $20 billion arms sale to Israel?

I will move to block these weapons. Not another nickel for Netanyahu’s illegal war.

Abolish Super PACs.

Overturn Citizens United.

End the practice of billionaires buying elections. https://t.co/RHU5oerhez

Amazon generates $36 billion in profits a year.

It’s not radical to think their workers shouldn’t live in poverty.

Amazon, stop your union busting. Obey the law. Allow workers to organize. https://t.co/eFRCYoxxYi

It is absurd that a billionaire in America today pays the same amount of Social Security taxes as someone making $168,000 a year.

It is time to scrap the cap, expand benefits, and fully fund Social Security. https://t.co/5HBH5cYrcG

There is no place for political violence, including the disturbing incident we just witnessed in West Palm Beach.  

We must denounce it in the strongest possible terms, and I am relieved that the former President is safe.

.@AliVelshi's  father recently had heart surgery in Canada.

The only thing he paid for?

Parking. https://t.co/5HHa6IWh9u

We must have the guts to talk about the greed of the people on top — people who want to move factories to China, shut down union drives, and pass massive tax breaks for the rich. https://t.co/Tsm5avgNBc

.@KamalaHarris did an extremely effective job at the debate in demonstrating how absolutely unfit Trump is to become president.

To win, she must expand her agenda to include popular solutions to the most important economic realities facing this country.

https://t.co/mFMNmRi89i

Democracy in America means one person, one vote.

It does not mean billionaires buying elections.

I would hope that everyone in this country, regardless of their political persuasion, can agree that we must overturn Citizens United. https://t.co/8n2C0wY9cb

Last year, Coca-Cola Co. spent $327 million on advertising in the United States, while the company raked in more than $9.5 billion in profits.

Not one of their ads will tell you that drinking 1 or 2 cans of Coke a day will increase your chances of getting Type 2 diabetes by 26%. https://t.co/2OAH8toeI6

Three people on top own more wealth than the bottom half of American society.

Billionaires pay an effective tax rate lower than truck drivers.

Elderly people cannot afford dental care.

Yes. It's time to take on the big monied interests that have so much power in our country. https://t.co/zc0y8ggvES

.@ATT is a multi-BILLION dollar company.

They can absolutely afford to treat their workers with the dignity they deserve.

AT&T must come to the table and negotiate a fair contract. https://t.co/oesx12QEKZ

Three words we can't use to describe prescription drugs in the US: nice, easy, affordable.

We have made some progress under President Biden — seniors now pay no more than $2k/year for their prescriptions.

But it's not enough. We must cap prescription costs for ALL Americans. https://t.co/CyzzugRF7S

Conservatives and progressives disagree on plenty, but many of us have something in common:

We do not want to see American democracy undermined by Donald Trump's cult of personality. https://t.co/CETZRkiwl3

Rather than obey the law and negotiate a new contract for its 17,000 workers, @ATT decided to illegally drag its feet and refuse to bargain in good faith. 

The company should stop playing these games with workers’ lives and reach a fair deal. https://t.co/GCwhroRjxX

Despair is not an option.

If you want to live in a sane and decent society, if you want a better world for your kids, you must stand up and fight for a better America. https://t.co/vNA5LBQqAe

Yes, Governor Walz has a defined benefit pension plan. That's good. He earned it.

At a time when about half of older workers have no retirement savings, we've got to restore defined benefit pensions so that all Americans can retire with the respect and the dignity they deserve. https://t.co/fuzKeFoS6l

As we celebrate Labor Day, let us continue the fight for a worker’s agenda that includes passing the PRO Act to end union busting; raising the federal minimum wage to a living wage; Paid Family and Medical Leave; and a pro-worker trade policy. Happy Labor Day. https://t.co/VpkxuDCEfK

As we approach Labor Day, let us not forget that the United States is the ONLY major nation not to guarantee workers paid family and medical leave.  

There are moms in this country who give birth, and are forced back to work a week later.  

Absolutely unacceptable.

Every scientist in the world understands that climate change is real, and caused by human activity.

If we don’t get a handle on it, it will only get worse.

Donald Trump believes that climate change “is a hoax created in China.”

That is insane. https://t.co/5cRhYYMPNN

82% of Americans believe that the wealthy and corporations should pay their fair share in taxes.

A small number of Wall Street executives and Silicon Valley investors disagree.

We cannot allow a handful of billionaire donors to decide our tax code. https://t.co/f6w2TCEewn

The Republican Party wants more tax breaks for billionaires, and massive cuts to Social Security and benefits.

It wants to allow polluters to destroy our planet and drug companies to charge us whatever they want.

THAT is radical. 

https://t.co/pydo9H5rV4

If the American people strongly support a progressive economic agenda, why hasn't it been implemented?

The answer is simple: Money.

We need to move to the public funding of elections, and end the practice of billionaires controlling our political process. https://t.co/55HSRmIa4p

70% of Americans support unions.

Why?

Union workers:

- Earn nearly 20% more than non-union workers on average.
- Are more likely to have good benefits like health care and pensions.
- Have greater protections against dangerous workplaces. https://t.co/hOGmDcjggh

We need to get Big Money out of our political process.

Billionaires in both parties should not be able to buy elections.

For the sake of our democracy we must overturn the disastrous Citizens United Supreme Court decision and move toward public funding of elections. https://t.co/LO31UNNx7m

The American people want stability in the White House.

They want somebody they can trust.

And more and more people are understanding that is not who Donald Trump is. https://t.co/nYKeaRjrug

Here's the truth about America today:

If you're rich, you'll live a long life.

If you're working class, you'll die 10 years sooner.

@TheoVon and I agree — it's time to do something about that discrepancy. https://t.co/LPtY514Ksa
Having private health insurance doesn’t mean a damn thing if you have a $7,000 deductible that you can’t afford. https://t.co/KVZRiFrINn

Olympic athletes competing in Paris were stunned to discover that, in France, free health care is a human right.

Meanwhile, in the U.S., 1 in 4 cancer patients go bankrupt or lose their homes because their treatment is so expensive.

We need Medicare for All. https://t.co/abu1AqED8b

.@KamalaHarris understands that good policy is good politics.

She is prepared to lower the cost of prescription drugs, end medical debt, and finally address the housing crisis that has touched every corner of this country. https://t.co/3Rk1C8hcte

We need @StevenHorsford's voice in Congress.

He is a powerful champion for workers and has been leading the fight in Nevada to make housing safer and more affordable.

I urge Nevadans to join me in supporting his campaign. https://t.co/aJ8GpppFmE

In the last three-and-a-half years, working together, we have accomplished more than any government since FDR.

But much more remains to be done.

We must have the courage to stand up to wealth and power and deliver justice for people at home and abroad. https://t.co/mSSYWz4vI9
Join me as I address the need to confront corporate greed at the DNC in Chicago. https://t.co/DrWqszx5eD

Tonight, I will address the Democratic National Convention.

Join me at 9:20pm EST.

https://t.co/cDvH9x6yXE https://t.co/EgB3Yyv7vE

The U.S. Senate must prioritize issues that the vast majority of Americans care about. 

I have a couple of ideas:

1) Expand Medicare to include vision, dental, and hearing

2) Expand Social Security

If Republicans want to vote no, I wish them luck in their next election. https://t.co/i5BqTUfUaL

The American people have been clear: they want a higher minimum wage, expanded Social Security, and better health care.

Donald Trump just wants to give billionaires another tax break.

This November, the choice is clear. https://t.co/YmUpnA0PvD
